However, there was lack of basic hospitality in terms of drinking bislery water, basic toiletries, lack of hooks & hangers, limited ventilation and absence of complimentary services with strict rules for each and every thing. Not worthy for a premium room rent of more than 3k per night.

text.text:
I booked this place expecting a *luxury boutique hotel* experience, but unfortunately, it was anything but that. The property felt shady from the moment I entered. The rooms were poorly maintained, with a constant unpleasant smell that made the stay very uncomfortable. Cleanliness and hygiene were a big concern; the bathrooms and linens did not feel properly cleaned, which is unacceptable for any hotel, let alone one that markets itself as “luxury.”

What made things worse was the staff. Instead of being courteous and helpful, they were uncooperative and dismissive of even basic requests. Hospitality was completely missing, which is surprising in a city like Jaipur that is otherwise known for its warmth and service.

Overall, this hotel is *far from* what it claims to be. If you’re looking for comfort, hygiene, and good service, I’d strongly recommend looking at other options in Jaipur. This place was a huge disappointment and not worth the money.

Just now I checked in, I booked luxurious bathtub room and it appeared to be very luxurious ( as mentioned ) and big in size. I was soo excited to check-in and make a video of the room and post on YouTube, to my surprise , it was such a low standard room. Just facilitating a bath tub and charging 5000 Rs for such room / day literally don’t justify!

We being a regular traveller have never faced such experience with any hotel with high star rating! I would say please don’t go after the rating and check thoroughly before booking !

text.text: We stayed at Sarang Palace for 4 nights. The rooms and washrooms were a bit smaller than what we expected from the photos, but the place was clean and well kept. The food here was honestly a highlight whatever we tried, whether breakfast, lunch or dinner, everything tasted really good and felt worth the price. The hotel is also close to the main tourist spots, and getting a tuk-tuk right outside was super easy. Overall, it was a good stay and I’d happily recommend it.

editorialSummary.text: Grand hotel in a converted 19th-century palace with a spa, elegant dining & banquet facilities.

text.text:
I recently stayed at your hotel and had a truly wonderful experience. Everything—from the warm hospitality to the cleanliness and comfort of the room—was exceptional. The staff was incredibly courteous and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. The service was prompt and professional, and every small detail was taken care of perfectly. I also really appreciated the overall ambiance and peaceful environment of the hotel. It made my stay relaxing and enjoyable.

Thank you for such a great experience! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and look forward to staying here again in the future.

text.text:
We recently stayed at Rambagh Palace in one of their Historical Suites, and it was an unforgettable experience. The entire property is breathtaking – full of character, history, and charm. Every part of the palace feels special, and just walking around it is a treat for the eyes.

Our suite was elegant, spacious, and incredibly comfortable. The decor reflected the royal heritage of the palace while still offering all the modern comforts you’d expect. The bed was super cozy, and every little detail – from the lighting to the bathroom essentials – was well thought out. It felt luxurious and homely at the same time.

What made the stay even more memorable were the unique experiences – vintage car rides, cultural performances, clay pot making, yoga, and even a horse carriage ride inside the palace grounds. These little touches added so much value to our trip and kept us engaged throughout.

One of the most charming things was the peacocks roaming freely around the property – they’re friendly and beautiful, and you can even feed them!

text.text: It’s the hotel for corporates, it’s absolutely perfect in every way. The staff and everyone is super helpful and prompt in their services. The rooms are comfortable & clean. 100% recommended 👍

originalText.text: It’s the hotel for corporates, it’s absolutely perfect in every way. The staff and everyone is super helpful and prompt in their services. The rooms are comfortable & clean. 100% recommended 👍

text.text:
We stayed in the Superior King Room Category. Our experience was delightful. We reached before time and got the room without much wait before the check-in time. We requested a room with a nice city view which was also acknowledged by the property.
The rooms are well maintained and bedding is comfortable.
The breakfast is delicious and lots of variety (I was actually amazed).
The highlight is Jaipur Local Cafe at the rooftop with beautiful panoramic views of Jaipur city. Happening vibe for partying and nice food. You don't require to go outside and lookout for any cafe...it's pretty much best in town.
Overally my stay was good and I would recommend all if you plan to book your stay at the property.
There is some renovation work going on at the moment but it's not at all a deal breaker. Rather one would not even notice. Property has hidden it very well and maintained proper hygiene and cleanliness.
The only issue I noticed was pigeon around the pool. I preferred not to use it because of that. This issue should be looked at and corrected.

text.text:
5 star reviews are fake and paid.

Terrible experience at this hotel. Please stay away.

Not safe if you are with family(-women/kids).

The 5 star reviews are fake and paid. Not by real visitors. Not sure why google allow those to be posted.

Rooms at this hotel are small, dirty and busted(broken doors, paint chipping off from walls, plaster coming out from ceiling) with unpleasant smell.

During our visit, AC started leaking water in the middle of the night.

We noticed telephone lines were broken and had to use our phones to call main desk guy, so technically there is no room service.

They keep two water bottles in the room before check-in without telling you its chargeable. They will charge you at the time of checkout and sell a Rs.20 water bottle for Rs. 30.

Some 5-10 punks are always present at the property(- they were friends with the manager and always hanging around) and gambling/drinking at night. Not sure what other business property manager is running(-betting??).

There is no reason why goons have to be present at the hotel property. I am sure their primary business is something else and not hoteling.

Manager(Hari Om) was very very rude, please be prepared for the harassment if you stay at this hotel and ask them for basic needs. We saw him behaving badly with other guests.

Forget about additional services, they do not provide basic services for which they charge heavy tariff and you have to pay full amount at the time of check-in(-that's very unprofessional).

Our biggest mistake was that we trusted fake photos and fake reviews and booked it remotely without seeing hotel rooms in person(-we had no choice).

Not going back to this hotel again. Please stay away.

During our visit, AC started leaking water in the middle of the night.

We noticed telephone lines were broken and had to use our phones to call main desk guy, so technically there is no room service.

They keep two water bottles in the room before check-in without telling you its chargeable. They will charge you at the time of checkout and sell a Rs.20 water bottle for Rs. 30.

Some 5-10 punks are always present at the property(- they were friends with the manager and always hanging around) and gambling/drinking at night. Not sure what other business property manager is running(-betting??).

There is no reason why goons have to be present at the hotel property. I am sure their primary business is something else and not hoteling.

Manager(Hari Om) was very very rude, please be prepared for the harassment if you stay at this hotel and ask them for basic needs. We saw him behaving badly with other guests.

Forget about additional services, they do not provide basic services for which they charge heavy tariff and you have to pay full amount at the time of check-in(-that's very unprofessional).

Our biggest mistake was that we trusted fake photos and fake reviews and booked it remotely without seeing hotel rooms in person(-we had no choice).

Not going back to this hotel again. Please stay away.

text.text:
★☆☆☆☆ Disappointing Stay – Rude Staff & Hidden Charges

My experience at this hotel was very disappointing. The receptionist was rude and unprofessional, saying things like "Itne mein itna hi milega" even though I had booked through a reputed online platform.

There were hidden charges—I was charged ₹30 for a water bottle with an MRP of ₹20.

The positive reviews online seem fake, as the reality doesn’t match the hype. Amenities like “24-hour room service” were unreliable, and the food was average and overpriced. The location is also inconvenient.

Overall, a poor experience. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

text.text:
Stayed at Ibis Hotel Jaipur recently and found it to be a decent option for short stays or business trips. The rooms are compact and functional—nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable enough for a good night’s rest. Basic amenities are provided, though the interiors could use a refresh to feel more inviting.
Service was average overall. Staff were polite but not particularly proactive, and check-in/check-out felt a bit mechanical. That said, any requests were eventually handled without major issues.

text.text:
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with my recent experience at your property.
From the moment we arrived, the service did not meet our expectations based on what was promised on your website. The check-in time was clearly stated as 2:00 PM, yet we were only given our room keys at 4:00 PM—a full two hours later. This delay was incredibly frustrating, especially after a long journey.
Even more disappointing is that despite lengthy conversations with the staff, we were not provided with the room we had originally booked. The accommodations we received were not in line with what was shown or described online and were not worth the price we paid.
Furthermore, the welcome and service upon arrival were far from warm or professional, which only added to our frustration.
This experience was not only inconvenient but also left us feeling misled and undervalued as guests. I hope you take this feedback seriously and look into these issues to ensure future guests do not face the same disappointment.

text.text:
I had one of the worst experiences during my 3-day stay at this hotel. The staff’s behavior was completely unprofessional, rude, and careless — definitely not what you expect from a place that calls itself a hotel. Instead of making guests feel comfortable, they act as if they are doing a favor by even responding.

The service is painfully slow. Their so-called breakfast is a nightmare — you’ll have to wait nearly 2 hours just for the simplest items, and when it finally arrives, it’s cold and poorly prepared. It’s better to step out and eat elsewhere rather than waste your morning waiting here.

Rooms and amenities don’t make up for the pathetic service. Overall, the entire stay was a disappointment from start to finish. They absolutely deserve the worst review possible. Avoid this place at all costs.

One of the best hotels in Jaipur. I have stayed at other hotels in Jaipur like Hyatt and lemon tree, but i think this was one of the finest hotel experiences that I have had in this city. Right from the check-in till check-out the staff was courteous and helpful at each point. The cleanliness of rooms were exquisite and the housekeeping staff was really prompt. I must mention the food of the hotel which was a highlight of my trip as I took all my meals in the hotel itself which was a delightful experience, the breakfast spread was good and had lots of vegetarian options. Overall, if you are looking to stay near the city and looking for top-notch amenities with a customer centric experience you can go with this hotel.

I hope the hotel team and staff will maintain this experience and I look forward to my next visit soon.

text.text:
I’ve had the opportunity to stay at Shakun Hotels & Resorts twice, and overall, both experiences have been pleasant. The hotel maintains a good standard in terms of cleanliness, amenities, and comfort, which I truly appreciate.

That said, I did notice a bit of a difference in service quality between my two visits. During my earlier stay, the staff who we interacted stood out for their warmth and attentiveness, which really enhanced the overall experience. However, on my recent visit, the interactions felt a bit more reserved. The staff seemed preoccupied, and there was a noticeable lack of the usual smiles and friendly engagement. It may have been a busy day or other internal demands, but it did impact the otherwise welcoming atmosphere I had come to expect.

I still consider Shakun Hotels & Resorts a good choice for a comfortable and reliable stay, and I hope to see that signature warmth return on my next visit. A little more attentiveness from the team would truly elevate the guest experience.

text.text:
We had booked online at Umaid Bhawan. We got free pick-up facility. But as soon as we reached, we had to carry our luggage ourselves to the reception because there was no bell boy available to help. We checked in a room but the curtains there were torn, so they shifted us to another room. As soon as we entered the another room, the room was so small that even our luggage bag could not be opened. The balcony was also very small. When we complained at the reception that these were not the category of rooms that we had booked, the receptionist said that this is heritage property and all the rooms here are same. The pictures on the internet are just for reference. We were very surprised but they ignored us. The tea bags provided in the rooms were also open and not in proper packaging, which is below standard for a heritage property. When we tried to turn on the TV, we found out that the set top box was faulty. The housekeeping staff tried to fix the TV for half an hour but finally said sorry and left. Then our wifi was also not working so we complained to the reception twice but still we did not get any help. Our booking was for 2 days but we immediately cancelled our bookings for the next day and booked in another hotel. Because there is no point in staying where guests' comfort is not taken care of. Decor and food was good. Otherwise service needs improvement.
So our stay at Umaid Bhawan Royal Style Heritage Boutique Hotel was nothing special.

text.text:
The front desk staff, Bharat, was friendly, warm, and helpful. When we checked in, there was a small problem with the room we had booked, so he couldn’t give us that exact one. But he handled it quickly, helped us as much as he could, and gave us another room that was very comfortable — even better than we expected.

This hotel is very unique — it was the most memorable one on our whole trip. It was started in 1993 by a former royal family from Borunda. The whole place has a royal Rajasthani style, like an old palace, with carved balconies and a rooftop restaurant. Staying here felt like traveling back in time… almost like being royalty!

The hotel breakfast was also great, with many tasty options. The staff were very kind and welcoming. If you ever visit Jaipur, you should definitely stay here for a night—or even a few nights. You won’t regret it :)

text.text:
Horrendous Experience – Avoid at All Costs!

I stayed at this property for a day, and it was an absolute nightmare.

**Rooms** – While the rooms are spacious, that’s the only positive. The toiletries are a joke—just an unmarked shampoo and a coagulated body wash that comes out in lumps, barely enough for one use. Nothing else provided. Water pressure is pathetic; it takes ages to get a decent flow. The toilets are not the cleanest with stains.

**Service** – Absolutely appalling. The reception is always unmanned; staff members are simply missing. The so-called "manager" is dishonest and overcharges for cabs. If you book through them, expect to pay extra. Even if the cab doesn’t cover all promised destinations, they still demand full payment. The manager’s attitude is downright aggressive—rude to the point of being threatening. On top of that, they charge extra for late check-out on an hourly basis. I was forced to pay ₹150 extra per room—₹300 total for two rooms despite the hotel being fully empty with no bookings.

I have no clue how this place has high ratings— Do yourself a favor and stay away!

text.text:
Had given them a perfect 5 star review earlier. Deleted that one and posting a new one now. The manager was acting as if he's running a 'hostel' rather than a hotel. On 2nd day of our stay we went to Amer Fort early in the morning. Our friend who was a local joined us at the fort. We all came back to room around 11am. We had planned to go out once again around 3-4 PM(which we did). Between this period our friend stayed back as he lived 25km from the hotel. The commute would have been a waste of time and money.
Now, during checkout the next day, the manager demanded an extra amount of 500-550 for that 11 am to 4pm window of stay - accusing us of letting our friend stay there for free. I have travelled to so many places and stayed at so many hotels but never have I ever come across such rule and If you do have such rules for your property do a better job of mentioning it on your website and other platforms where you list your accommodations. See the thing is when people travel, their friends and family in that city often drop by their hotels. Had we known about these hidden charges thn we would have not booked your hotel.

text.text:
The hotel offers an overall average experience. Its location on the main road makes it easily accessible, with the local market situated nearby. During my stay, the reception area was under renovation, which may have affected the first impression.

The room was spacious and comfortable in size; however, the interiors appeared outdated and would benefit from modernization. In comparison, other three- and four-star properties within the same price range tend to provide more contemporary rooms, enhanced amenities, and additional facilities.

The morning buffet was satisfactory, with a reasonable variety of options available. Service throughout the stay was adequate. That said, the in-room dining menu was average in both taste and presentation.

Summary: A conveniently located property with decent service and food, but one that requires significant upgrades to match the standards of competing hotels in its category.

text.text:
I booked this hotel because I had high expectations. My previous stay at Red Fox, Dehradun was great and I was expecting a similar experience. Well that didn’t happen. Let me summarize the good and bad.

Good:
* Location is good for business travelers and for those using their own cars.
* The quality of lunch and dinner preparations was excellent, mostly because it is made to order.
* Overall upkeep of the hotel is good.
* The waiting staff in the restaurant was perhaps the most polite I’ve found in Rajasthan.

Bad:
* Check-in was slow.
* The reception and lobby was located on the first floor, unlike most other hotels where it is up front at the entrance. This is always a surprise to a new guest, who generally expect it to be at the front door of the hotel.
* The bed was uncomfortable. Maybe this was only in my room but it is worth noting.
* The obsession with QR code for the restaurant menu. I know it’s a cost cutting measure but come on Red Fox! You can do better than most other budget hotels by simply adding a physical menu to your services.
* The breakfast was just about average.
* The closets in the rooms should at least have a sliding door to keep things safe. Not having it is another cost cutting measure but surely it can be addressed.

Finally, I must appreciate the differently abled staff members. I saw two of them and their energy was unmatched! A big thumbs up to them. 👍🏼

text.text:
I don’t normally post bad reviews but I had to for this place. My partner and I are from New Zealand and we didn’t have a pleasant experience here and that is putting it nicely. We walked in at around 3pm and they were still cleaning the entire floor after having a wedding function there. There was literal rubbish and dirt in the hallway which was being swept out of each of the rooms. We had to dodge all that while walking to our room. Our room was really run down and still seemed dirty. The AC wasn’t working. My partner opened up one of the cupboards to be blasted with an overwhelming smell of urine. He closed it immediately and didn’t open it for the rest of the time we were staying there. Later on in the evening our entire room started smelling of urine/ sewer. None of the bathrooms had separation glass or curtain between the shower, toilet or sink so once we had a shower, the whole bathroom floor became wet. We had to have cold bucket showers on the first night as the shower head wasn’t working and hot water wasn’t coming out. We had other family members staying in other rooms so I asked them if their showers were working and they had the same situation as we did. We addressed this with the staff on the night and they said they will get someone to try to fix it in the morning. We don’t know if they fixed it because we moved to another room where we made sure the shower head was working as well as the hot water, AC and the room smelt some what okay. Someone else moved into our room and I noticed that as we walked past the room, the overwhelming smell of sewage was still present. Also, we caught a glimpse of the mattress protector that we were sleeping on while they were moving our rooms and it was absolutely disgusting - picture attached. The place itself is located close-ish to the city centre and it was easy to get an uber and the food is nice - those are the only positive things I can say about this place.

My partner and I would’ve moved out of the place as soon as we saw it however, we had 20 or so other family members staying there for a wedding so we tolerated it to the best of our abilities. My entire group caught a cold by the end of our stay because of the conditions of the hotel. I ABSOLUTELY WOULD NOT RECOMMEND STAYING HERE.

text.text:
If you’re booking Radisson Blu expecting a true 5-star experience, you are likely to be very disappointed. It’s definitely not a 5 star. We stayed there from 15–17 August 2025 and almost every aspect fell short of what the Radisson name usually stands for.

The duty manager had promised a birthday cake and room decoration for our parents, ( had called
Him and spoken personally) but when we arrived, there was nothing. Even our rooms were kit ready even though we checked in way past the check in time.

The hotel itself feels tired. The entrance has an extremely small foyer with little charm, not impressive at all. The lobby has a seemed to have an artificial floral smell, and the overall look of the exterior and interior is dated and run down. Rooms are decently sized but lack any sense of luxury. Peeling paint, stains, and even loud plumbing noises that sounded like a drill machine made the stay uncomfortable.  They don’t feel too clean.

Service was equally underwhelming. Check-in at reception was delayed and inefficient. Breakfast was overcrowded and poorly managed, and the lobby-level restaurant was painfully slow with à la carte orders. Small but important details were overlooked, such as no iron in the room (though there was an ironing board), towels not replaced during service, and only very limited TV channels available.

On the positive side, room service was comparatively quick and the room size was comfortable. But overall, the hotel does not measure up to a 5-star standard. At best, it feels like a mid-range property trading on the Radisson name rather than delivering the experience guests expect.

text.text:
Jaipur, the "Pink City," offers a vibrant and memorable experience for visitors. Known for its rich culture, stunning architecture, and bustling markets, Jaipur is a city that truly captures the essence of Rajasthan. The city's historic buildings, like the iconic Hawa Mahal and the majestic Amber Fort, transport you back in time, showcasing the grandeur of the past.
The city's vibrant markets, teeming with colorful fabrics, exquisite handicrafts, and delicious street food, are a delight for the senses. Jaipur's commitment towards tradition and hospitality is evident in every corner, making it a welcoming and unforgettable destination. The city's blend of ancient heritage and modern amenities creates a unique and captivating atmosphere.
Overall experience good 👍

text.text:
One of the most breathtaking places I’ve ever visited!

I recently visited Rajmahal Palace in Jaipur, and honestly — I’m speechless! The beauty of this place is just unreal. Lush greenery everywhere, aesthetic vibes all around, and the sound of peacocks in the background made it feel like a scene from a royal dream. The palace itself gives proper mahal wali vibe — perfect for a peaceful date, a shoot, or just to soak in the grandeur.

Every corner is photogenic — literally Instagram heaven. I couldn’t get enough of it. The café and restaurant inside are also top-notch — both in service and taste.

I didn’t stay this time, but next time I’m definitely booking a stay here to experience the royal hospitality to the fullest.
Highly recommend this gem in Jaipur!

text.text:
Terrible Experience - Not Safe, Avoid at All Costs!

My wife and I booked this hotel for our stay in Jaipur, India, expecting a safe and comfortable place to rest during our travels from the USA. Unfortunately, our experience turned out to be nothing short of a nightmare.

Around 11 PM on the night 1, while we were in our room sleeping, the ceiling suddenly collapsed on us. The room's fan was bent, and as debris fell, my wife was injured with some scratches and a small injury to her head. Thankfully, we weren’t more seriously hurt, but this incident left us shaken and traumatized. The hotel did offer us a refund and free meals, but after such a terrifying experience, we couldn’t trust the safety of the place anymore.

We chose this hotel based on its appearance and amenities, but after the ceiling collapse, it was clear that the building was poorly maintained. It didn’t seem safe, and the lack of guests staying there only added to our concerns. We immediately cut our trip short after the incident and decided to stay at another hotel.

I would strongly advise anyone considering this hotel to look elsewhere. It was a terrifying experience that left us with lasting trauma, and it’s not worth the risk to your safety.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Rambagh Palace in Jaipur and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. This ornate converted palace, dating back to 1835, is a true gem of Jaipur.

From the moment I arrived, I was struck by the palace's grandeur and elegance. The staff were welcoming and attentive, ensuring that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and beautifully decorated, with all the modern amenities one could need.

The dining options at Rambagh Palace were exceptional. The two genteel restaurants served a variety of delicious dishes, each prepared with the freshest ingredients and presented beautifully. The two bars and open-air cafe were also great spots to unwind and enjoy a drink or a light snack.

The gym and spa facilities were excellent, offering a range of treatments and services that catered to all my needs. The indoor and outdoor pools were also great amenities, providing a relaxing oasis in the heart of the city. The yoga and meditation classes that were arranged for us were a great way to start our day and set the tone for a relaxing and rejuvenating stay.

Overall, I would highly recommend Rambagh Palace to anyone visiting Jaipur. The ornate palace, with its rich history and unparalleled luxury, offered an experience like no other. The attentive staff, exceptional dining options, and excellent amenities made it a truly memorable stay. I can't wait to return for another visit.

text.text:
A Memorable Stay

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Rambagh Palace, and I must say, it was an experience worth cherishing. From the moment I arrived, the staff's warm and welcoming demeanor made me feel right at home. Their attention to detail and genuine hospitality were truly commendable.

Ambiance & Cleanliness:
The hotel boasts a modern yet cozy ambiance, with tastefully designed interiors that exude elegance. Every corner of the property was impeccably clean, reflecting their commitment to hygiene and guest comfort.

Rooms:
The room I stayed in was spacious, well-lit, and thoughtfully furnished. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. Small touches like complimentary snacks, a well-stocked minibar, and plush linens added to the overall luxury.

Dining:
The on-site restaurant was a highlight of my stay. The menu offered a delightful mix of local and international cuisines, and every dish I tried was bursting with flavor. The breakfast buffet, in particular, was a feast with a wide variety of options to suit every palate.

Amenities:
The hotel offers a range of amenities, including a serene pool, a well-equipped gym, and a spa that provided a truly relaxing experience. These facilities were well-maintained and added immense value to my stay.

Service:
What truly sets Rambagh Palace apart is its exceptional service. The staff went above and beyond to cater to my needs, always with a smile. Whether it was arranging transportation or providing local recommendations, they were incredibly helpful.

Location:
Conveniently located, the hotel is close to major attractions and easily accessible. Despite being in a bustling area, the property maintained a peaceful atmosphere.

Overall:
Rambagh Palace exceeded my expectations in every way. Whether you're traveling for business or leisure, this hotel is a fantastic choice. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a blend of comfort, luxury, and outstanding service. I can't wait to return!

highlightedText.text: "We carefully went through reviews of many 4 star/5 star hotels in Jaipur."

text.text:
Excellent stay. We carefully went through reviews of many 4 star/5 star hotels in Jaipur. After carefully reviewing quite a few and considering the distance from Bapu Bazaar/Johri Bazaar and other important places, and the cost, we zeroed in Lemon Tree Premiere as the preferred hotel.

It lived up to its expectations. Great service, very neat and clean hotel, everyone from Reception (Karan and one lady whose name I forgot) to Room service to Restaurant were polite and forthcoming. Seeing the tub in the bathroom, the kids were interested to do a bubble bath. In no time, they provided us with the liquid we needed for it. Gave us free upgrade, no charge on 2.5 hours late checkout etc. etc.

Key things: cleanliness of the hotel and promptness of the staff.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Rajasthan Palace during my visit to the magnificent city of Jaipur, and I must say that it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted with warm smiles and impeccable hospitality, setting the tone for an unforgettable experience.

Let's start with the highlight of my stay: the food. The culinary delights offered at Hotel Rajasthan Palace were simply exquisite. Each meal was a culinary adventure, showcasing the rich flavors and traditional recipes of Rajasthan. From the aromatic spices in their curries to the mouthwatering desserts, every dish was a true gastronomic masterpiece. The menu catered to a variety of palates, ensuring that there was something to satisfy every craving. I particularly recommend trying their signature Rajasthani thali, a delightful assortment of regional specialties that left me craving for more.

The ambience of the hotel deserves special mention. The decor exuded elegance and charm, reflecting the cultural heritage of Rajasthan. The attention to detail was remarkable, from the intricately designed furnishings to the beautiful artwork adorning the walls. Whether it was the serene courtyard or the cozy restaurant, every corner of the hotel exuded a sense of tranquility and sophistication. It provided the perfect ambiance for relaxation after a long day of exploring the vibrant city.

What truly set Hotel Rajasthan Palace apart was the exceptional service provided by the staff. The team went above and beyond to ensure that every aspect of my stay was flawless. They were attentive, friendly, and always ready to assist with any request. The staff's extensive knowledge about the local attractions and their helpful recommendations further enhanced my overall experience.

I must also mention the comfortable and well-appointed rooms that provided a sanctuary of comfort during my stay. The attention to detail was evident in the thoughtful amenities and the plush bedding, ensuring a restful night's sleep. Waking up to a breathtaking view of the city skyline was an added bonus.

The hotel's location was another advantage, situated conveniently close to major attractions and landmarks. It allowed me to explore the city with ease, while also providing a peaceful retreat away from the bustling streets.

In conclusion, my experience at Hotel Rajasthan Palace was nothing short of exceptional. The delicious food, captivating ambience, and impeccable service made my stay truly memorable. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a truly immersive and delightful experience during their visit to Jaipur. I am already looking forward to my next stay at Hotel Rajasthan Palace, eager to indulge in their culinary treasures once again.

text.text:
All-Time Favourite Stay in Jaipur!

Ibis Jaipur has always been my top choice whenever I visit the city. The hotel offers a consistently pleasant experience—thanks to the courteous and attentive staff who make every stay memorable. The Spice It restaurant never disappoints with its wide variety of cuisines and consistently delicious food.

The rooms are always well-prepared with all the basic amenities in place. Housekeeping staff are prompt and efficient, always ready to clean and set the room just right. Another big plus is their early morning breakfast service, starting at 6:30 am—perfect for early risers or business travelers.

A special thanks to Tanbir from the F&B department. He’s truly a gem—always welcoming guests with a smile and a positive attitude. Polite, helpful, and professional, Tanbir made every dining experience at Spice It feel warm and personal. I heard today is your last day at Ibis—wishing you all the best in your future endeavors!

I also want to highlight the reception staff, who have always been incredibly professional and accommodating. From a smooth and quick check-in process to helping me change rooms without any hassle when needed, they’ve shown great efficiency and hospitality. Their willingness to assist and ensure a comfortable stay really stands out.

Overall, I give this hotel a solid 10/10. A must-visit stay for anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient hotel experience in Jaipur—whether it’s a weekend getaway or a longer vacation. Totally worth it!💯

text.text:
I had the pleasure of staying at ITC Rajputana during my recent visit to Jaipur, and I must say it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. Shalu from guest relations assisted us through the whole stay. From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warm and welcoming hospitality that truly made me feel like a valued guest.

The hotel's architecture and decor reflect the rich cultural heritage of Rajasthan, creating a mesmerizing and immersive atmosphere. My room was spacious, beautifully appointed, and offered breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

One of the highlights of my stay was the culinary journey I embarked on at ITC Rajputana. The diverse dining options offered an array of delectable dishes, from traditional Rajasthani cuisine to international favorites. Each meal was a culinary adventure, and the service was impeccable.

The staff at ITC Rajputana went above and beyond to ensure my stay was comfortable and memorable. They were always attentive to my needs and eager to assist with any request. Whether it was arranging a local tour or providing recommendations for exploring Jaipur, their knowledge and enthusiasm were invaluable.

The hotel's facilities, including the spa and pool area, provided the perfect relaxation after a day of sightseeing. The attention to detail in every aspect of the hotel's design and service truly sets ITC Rajputana apart.

In conclusion, ITC Rajputana exceeded my expectations in every way. It's a haven of luxury, culture, and hospitality that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Jaipur. My stay was a true reflection of the royal charm of Rajasthan, and I can't wait to return for another unforgettable experience.

highlightedText.text: "Probably one of the oldest 5 star hotels in Jaipur."

text.text:
Probably one of the oldest 5 star hotels in Jaipur. Located very close to the railway station, but local transport seems to be a bit of an issue due to non sensical traffic restrictions. Probably another way for the local cops to earn under the table.
Anyhow this hotel is good.

Food at the gf restaurant is amazing, the best food iv had at a 5 star.

Staff courtesy and response is good. Try and book pool view rooms even if slightly more expensive as the city view rooms are located at the ends of long narrow low ceiling corridors, which reduces the premium feel of the hotel.

text.text:
I recently stayed at the Golden Tulip Jaipur Hotel and had a mostly pleasant experience. The food was an absolute highlight—scrumptious and with a huge variety to choose from! Whether it was the breakfast buffet or the à la carte options, every meal was delicious and satisfying. The rooms were spacious and well-maintained, offering a comfortable stay.

The hospitality here was truly commendable. The staff greeted us with wide smiles and went out of their way to ensure we felt welcome. Their warmth and attentiveness added a special touch to our stay.

However, there was one significant issue: the lighting in the room had many issues. It made the space feel dim and less inviting as I couldn’t turn on certain lights, especially in the evenings. We did provide this feedback to the staff, and they were polite and receptive, so I hope this gets addressed soon.

Aside from the lighting, the stay was enjoyable. The combination of great food, spacious rooms, and excellent hospitality made for a comfortable experience. I’d recommend this hotel for its many positives, but I hope they improve the lighting situation for future guests. A solid 4-star experience overall!

text.text:
Let me be honest to begin with, Umaid Bhavan was the last place we looked at when we were searching for stays in Jaipur. Having looked at some of the other heritage style resorts, which seemed pretty good, but since reviews mentioned rooms/property were not in line with what they had seen in pics, we explored a bit more and came across this place in the last moment. Looking at the pics and reviews, we somehow liked this better than the others so decided to book this off. Really glad we did!

The whole property is beautiful, with a nice royal heritage touch throughout. On the day of check in, they were courteous enough to let's check in a couple of hrs early, felt good since we wanted to rest a bit before getting on with our touristy activities :)

When we entered the royal suite that we had reserved, we were pleasantly surprised with the neatness of the room and the beautiful heritage look it had throughout!And it was huugeeee! Probably the biggest room we have stayed in so far!  The bed, the sofa, chairs, ceiling, the sit out area adjacent to windows with a view of the swimming pool, everything accentuated the look and feel of the room.

Coming to common areas in the property, each floor has been given a beautiful heritage look, including the stairs where they have thoughtfully kept accessories to accentuate the look. We loved spending a bit of time at different spots taking pics 😃 A big shoutout to the management and staff here for their attention to keeping the property and rooms so neat and clean!

Though initially we had planned to eat only once in their in house restaurant and eat out rest of the times, we ended up eating all our meals here except for the lunch on 2nd day when we were out visiting forts! Dining area on terrace has a simple yet beautiful look and feel. What drew us to it subsequently was the tasty lunch we had here, we didn't need to worry about where to eat next! They provided good service throughout, so that's a plus point. At night, they have a group playing local traditional songs accompanied by some dance performances, which was good to witness while we enjoyed our drinks and ate away yummy food :)

I can say, without a doubt, that everything we experienced here in person was much better than what we had seen in pics!

The only drawback we experienced was, their buffet breakfast was not up to mark, especially the south indian items. But that was a minor thing for us considering how great everything else was!

Would highly recommend for people wanting to stay in a heritage style property in Jaipur at a reasonable cost. This being located centrally, visiting market or other touristy spots was easier too.

text.text:
It's a nice cosy boutique hotel.
Feels like you have travelled back in time, with a physical register for check-in, actual keys with metal key chain as opposed to the chip enabled cards.
Rooms are comfortable and the artwork on the ceiling and walls are good
The service is fine considering the time period in which you get transported.
Breakfast is a buffet self service one which is not that out of place, though you may not have waiters asking you to serve tea or anything else, you need something you get up from your chair and get it.
There is good WiFi connection.
Worth every penny considering that we got a good deal in October 2021.

The chef's attention to detail and commitment to quality truly elevated our dining experience.

highlightedText.text: "I stayed at The Leela Jaipur and it was one of the best hotel stays ever!"

text.text: I stayed at The Leela Jaipur and it was one of the best hotel stays ever! It is only 4 hours away from delhi and I went with my bestfriend! On the entry Mr. Dharamraj will escort you in the hotel with a big red umbrella palace style! Its really lavish! The buffet breakfast was amazing with a tea stall and a flautist! The spa service was also really good! My therapist Benu suggested me a really good massage for my backache. They also have a Hi tea called Dharohar- which includes traditional dances, henna tattoos and pottery! Definitely a really fun and beautiful experience with tea and snacks! The dinner at Mohan mahal was the most Royal and lavish experience ever! Its a all mirror interior with only candles lit everywhere! Typically this must be how kings use to dine! The food and the thali at mohan mahal were amazing too! I also tried their italian restaurant! I would highly recommend the ravioli and risotto. Overall 10/10 for this property

text.text:
A Majestic Oasis in the Heart of Jaipur

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Jaipur Marriott Hotel, and I must say it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I entered the grand lobby to the minute I reluctantly checked out, every aspect of my experience was nothing short of exceptional.

The hotel's ambiance exudes a perfect blend of regal charm and contemporary luxury. The attention to detail in the decor, with its intricate Rajasthani motifs and elegant furnishings, truly transported me to a bygone era while still offering all the modern comforts I could desire.

The staff at Jaipur Marriott Hotel are a testament to exceptional hospitality. They greeted me with genuine warmth and a heartfelt smile, making me feel like a valued guest from the very beginning. Every interaction with the staff was marked by their professionalism, efficiency, and an eagerness to cater to my needs.

My room was a sanctuary of comfort and style. The plush bedding, tasteful decor, and breathtaking city views made it difficult to leave the confines of this luxurious haven. The amenities provided were top-notch, and the attention to cleanliness and hygiene was commendable.

Dining at Jaipur Marriott Hotel was an absolute delight. The diverse array of culinary offerings catered to every palate, from delectable local delicacies to international cuisines prepared with finesse. The restaurants and bars provided an inviting ambiance, and the impeccable service of the staff enhanced the overall dining experience.

In conclusion, my stay at Jaipur Marriott Hotel was an enchanting experience that I will cherish forever. The impeccable service, luxurious accommodations, delectable dining options, and prime location make it the perfect choice for both leisure and business travelers. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a truly unforgettable stay in the Pink City.

Red Fox by Lemon Tree in Jaipur offers a comfortable and affordable stay option. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-maintained, equipped with essential amenities. However, it's important to note that amenities like toiletries and slippers are chargeable, which could be considered a minor drawback.

Ample parking is available on-site, and the hotel's service is prompt and efficient. Its location is convenient, placing guests within easy reach of many of Jaipur's major attractions.
The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch, adding value to the overall experience.

Overall, Red Fox by Lemon Tree is a suitable choice for budget-conscious travelers seeking a comfortable and convenient base for exploring Jaipur.

text.text: They brand this hotel as a heritage stay, but except the artworks in the rooms nothing was great. First of all they don't have an elevator, but as our rooms were in the first floor it was ok for us. It's a very old property located little interior to the main city. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and spacious. They do have a balcony but it's not maintained properly, the chairs were full of dust and cigarette ashes were all over the balcony. The worst thing here is the food and service. As they said they have a roof top restaurant, we went there for dinner (one have to use the stairs to reach there) but even after waiting for 20 mins no one cared to attend us. The food is not at all tasty. They don't even provide complimentary mineral water bottles and everything is chargeable. No kettles available in the rooms. The owner seemed nice, but who will opt a hotel just by considering that.

highlightedText.text: "We found this hotel/ homestay over Google, as we were reaching Jaipur."

text.text:
This is essentially a home stay, located within a residential area. It's simple, neat and clean place and fits good in budget. The food prepared is fresh and homely style, and so they take time to serve the food. This place is frequented by foreign tourists a lot.

We were a family of 4, styed in the family suite (Room 202). The bedsheets and pillows were neat and clean. The room is equipped with window AC. There is TV made using a computer monitor, but serves the purpose as it showcases cartoon channels which children enjoy. The washroom is big and clean and has hot water supply.

There is no lift in this building so it might be a issue for senior citizens to book this place, as one has to take stairs to go to the rooms. It has an eating place at its terrace (rooftop restaurant). The restaurant is however not well maintained and tables are often left in dirty condition.

We found this hotel/ homestay over Google, as we were reaching Jaipur. For booking, we made an UPI of Rs. 500/- as advance, the very day we were reaching and the owner was very accomodating and polite. The room rent was Rs. 3,000/-.

All in all a very good experience.

Only issue we found was with the aged man managing the restaurant on the roof-top. He has a big mouth and keeps justifying himself unnecessarily for late service of food. We merely asked him if he could prepare two more paratha, for which this person created a big issue and made unnecessary remarks. Since we were about to check out we simply ignored this man.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Hotel Jaipur Heritage and had a wonderful experience! The hotel's architecture and design are a beautiful blend of traditional Rajasthani style and modern comforts.

The rooms are spacious, clean, and well-maintained, with comfortable beds and amenities like AC, TV, and minibar. The bathroom was clean and well-stocked with toiletries.

The hotel's staff is friendly, courteous, and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and memorable.

The restaurant serves delicious food, with a wide range of options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The rooftop restaurant offers stunning views of the city.

The hotel's location is perfect for exploring Jaipur's attractions, with many popular sites within walking distance.

Overall, I highly recommend Hotel Jaipur Heritage for its excellent service, comfortable rooms, and great location. It's a great value for the price!

Only suggestion: Improve the Wi-Fi connectivity, as it was a bit patchy at times."

This review highlights the hotel's:

- Beautiful architecture and design
- Comfortable and clean rooms
- Friendly and helpful staff
- Delicious food and rooftop restaurant
- Great location for exploring Jaipur
- Good value for the price

text.text:
Delightful Dining Experience at Radisson Blu Jaipur Restaurant!

I recently visited the restaurant at Radisson Blu Jaipur and had a truly memorable culinary experience. From the elegant ambiance to the exceptional food quality, everything reflected the premium standards you expect from a five-star hotel.

The restaurant interiors are beautifully designed — spacious seating, warm lighting, and a calm atmosphere that makes you feel instantly relaxed. The staff was extremely courteous, well-trained, and attentive throughout the meal. Right from greeting us at the entrance to helping us with menu recommendations, the service was flawless.

Coming to the food — we opted for the buffet, and it exceeded our expectations in every way. The spread was extensive, covering a variety of Indian, continental, and Asian dishes. The live counters added a fresh touch, especially the pasta and chaat stations. Every dish was well-prepared, presented beautifully, and rich in authentic flavors.

The desserts section was another highlight — with multiple options including cakes, Indian sweets, fresh fruits, and ice creams. The quality of ingredients was evident, and the hygiene standards were top-notch.

For those preferring à la carte, the menu also offers a wide variety of gourmet dishes, and the chefs are happy to customize spice levels based on your taste.

Whether you're planning a family dinner, a business lunch, or even a special date night — the restaurant at Radisson Blu Jaipur is an excellent choice. The pricing is reasonable for the quality and experience offered. I would highly recommend it for anyone looking to enjoy a fine-dining experience in Jaipur.

One of the garden's standout features is its meticulous landscaping, creating a sense of tranquility and romance. From manicured lawns to blooming flower beds, every corner exudes charm and elegance, setting the stage for unforgettable moments.

One of the garden's standout features is its meticulous landscaping, creating a sense of tranquility and romance. From manicured lawns to blooming flower beds, every corner exudes charm and elegance, setting the stage for unforgettable moments.
The garden's versatility is another highlight, accommodating intimate gatherings and grand celebrations alike. Whether exchanging vows beneath a canopy of trees or dancing the night away under the stars, couples are afforded endless possibilities to tailor their dream wedding.

Moreover, the marriage garden's proximity to the city provides convenience without sacrificing the serenity of the countryside. Accessible yet secluded, it offers a welcome escape from the hustle and bustle, allowing couples and guests to immerse themselves in the joy of the occasion.

Attention to detail is evident throughout, with attentive staff ensuring seamless coordination and impeccable service. From personalized décor to delectable catering options, every aspect is carefully curated to exceed expectations and create cherished memories.

In conclusion, the marriage garden on the suburbs of the city is a testament to natural beauty and refined elegance. With its enchanting setting, versatile spaces, and attentive service, it promises to transform weddings into timeless celebrations of love and romance.
